SIA AR - Initial Prototype
fields.description: The very first version of the AR prototype

fields.title: Additionally, we activated the human segmentation func

content.value: Additionally, we activated the human segmentation function from AR Kit. This enabled us to properly crop the user's body or parts of their body and accurately place them in the AR scene when using an iPhone with LiDAR technology.

fields.title: In Unity, we utilized a Universal Rendering Pip

content.value: In Unity, we utilized a Universal Rendering Pipeline and a pencil effect to create a portal effect.

fields.title: Singapore AR - Internal Demo Video
fields.description: Internal video recording of the prototype

fields.title: Singapore AR Video - Jose Passing By
fields.description: Test demo: AR Kit human segmentation

fields.title: At the end, we were able to create a functional demo within a week and the

content.value: At the end, we were able to create a functional demo within a week and the basic AR prototype within three weeks, after many long days and nights of prototyping.

fields.title: We encountered a challenge where AR Kit'

content.value: We encountered a challenge where AR Kit's human segmentation only worked properly on models outside of the portal without the pencil effect. I found a workaround to move both the user and the cabinet (the economy class or the business class depending on if the user triggers the portal) outside of the portal after the portal transition is done.

fields.title: Imagine a customer is using the mobile app to book

content.value: Imagine a customer is using the mobile app to book a seat. By tapping a button, they would be transported to an AR view that displays a highly immersive representation of themselves seated in a business class seat. This would be achieved by segmenting their legs and body and placing them in the virtual scene, making it feel like they are actually sitting in the business class seat. To add a fun twist, we even thought about showcasing an economy seat for comparison, which would give customers a clearer idea of the differences and potentially entice them to upgrade to business class.

fields.title: Initially, we were drawn to the potential of new for

content.value: Initially, we were drawn to the potential of new forms of content such as Augmented Reality (AR), Virtual Reality (VR), Mixed Reality (MR), and Extended Reality (XR). We saw an opportunity to integrate AR/VR into Singapore Airlines' customer experience by showing them a preview of what it would be like to sit in a SIA business class seat while booking a ticket.

fields.content: Concept, Ideation, UI Design, UX, Animation, Unity Game Development, Presentation

fields.title: We also created similar AR demos fo

content.value: We also created similar AR demos for Thai Airways and Malaysia Airlines, which generated similar enthusiasm and interest from their clients. These demonstrations showcased the potential impact that AR could have on their businesses.

fields.title: In January, we presented the AR demo to Singapore Airlines clients and invited them to try the experience for themselves. The clien

content.value: In January, we presented the AR demo to Singapore Airlines clients and invited them to try the experience for themselves. The clients were impressed by the advancements that AR technology has made and showed great interest in how it could benefit their business.

fields.title: To bring our vision to life, we segmented the models

content.value: To bring our vision to life, we segmented the models into individual parts and added animations to each component. This allowed us to create a dynamic animation for the cabin seats and environment that would appear seamlessly.

fields.title: Hi 你好
fields.subtitle: I’m Jedy 陈宇航
fields.introduction:
I am a creative technologist with an academic background in electronic engineering and digital art. While working and living in New York, Tokyo, Singapore and Shanghai, I have been developing brand experiences, data visualizations, generative design, and interactive experiences for Nike, Samsung, Verizon, Shiseido, Google, Kao and more.

My works have received awards from One Club ADC Awards, the Creative Review, the One Show, and have exhibited in Shanghai International Science & Art Exhibition (Shanghai), Maker Faire (New York), iLight Festival (Singapore), China International Import Expo (Shanghai) and Awakening Bangkok (Bangkok).

fields.title: New York | United States
contentItem: 2014 - 2016 New York University, Tisch School of the Arts

fields.title: In terms of models, we were fortunate to find high-fidelity S

content.value: In terms of models, we were fortunate to find high-fidelity Singapore Airlines cabin models on Turbosquid that aligned with the airline's branding. This saved us a significant amount of time and effort.

fields.title: In light of these limitations, I determined that web AR

content.value: In light of these limitations, I determined that web AR would not enable us to create the high-fidelity experience we desired. We ultimately chose Unity AR Foundation (Apple AR Kit) as our AR platform due to its superior capabilities.

fields.title: After determining the direction for our experience, I conducted research on various AR platforms and techniques, including 8th Wall, Lens Studio, and Spa

content.value: After determining the direction for our experience, I conducted research on various AR platforms and techniques, including 8th Wall, Lens Studio, and Spark Studio. I discovered that these web-based AR platforms were limited in their capabilities and only supported content and models with file sizes less than 10 MB. Additionally, their functionality was limited compared to what could be achieved with native apps, lacking crucial features such as body segmentation and post-processing.

To enhance the proposal's value, the bidding team decided to include a section in the presentation titled "The Future of Content Creation". This section would showcase Accenture's perspective on the exciting changes and advancements in the field of content creation over the next five years. The goal was to demonstrate to Singapore Airlines how Accenture can help them navigate these changes if they choose Accenture as their partner.

The Accenture Song team was presenting a Digital Asset Management (DAM) and Content Management System (CMS) solution to Singapore Airlines. However, their initial proposal was deemed "standard and boring" by one of Accenture's leaders.

fields.title: Interactive AR Prototype
fields.subtitle: Singapore Airlines
fields.description: In December 2022, my team was tasked with developing an Augmented Reality (AR) experience for Accenture Song's business development project.

content.value: Additionally, I added some details such as haptic feedback when users rotating the wheel, similar to winding a watch, which can make the experience of tracking time more enjoyable and engaging, and it helps users to focus on the task at hand. The vibration also provides a sense of accomplishment each time the goal is met.

"Beyond Time" demonstrates the seamless integration of design, experience, and technology to create a unique combination of art, innovation, and science. The project showcases the successful integration of research and development with complex challenges and advanced technologies to produce a new and exciting outcome.

One year since its launch, "Beyond Time" has provided emotional experiences to over 10,000 people. Through more than 30,000 conversations about aging, participants have gained a more positive outlook on growing older. This has allowed Shiseido, a well-known beauty brand, to make a cultural statement that beauty can be found in aging, not just youth.

I collaborated closely with the design team to translate the scientific research and technological innovations behind "Beyond Time" into a visually engaging exhibition. The exhibition, located on the second floor, provides visitors with an opportunity to learn about the technologies and processes involved in an interactive and educational manner.

The 3D facial capture and rendering capabilities of our engine provide a high level of realism in the simulation. The engine accurately depicts environmental lighting, captures minor facial expressions, and generates dynamic skin wrinkling in real-time. This level of detail enhances the participants' engagement in the experience and enables them to connect emotionally as they journey through different stages of life.

fields.title: Innovation - Led the creation of our method

content.value: Leveraging cutting-edge technologies in computer vision, face tracking, and computer graphics rendering, I directed the development of a unique and innovative age simulation system. This system utilizes the aging patterns derived from our 3D facial data to digitally reproduce the aging process on a user's face in real-time and in 3D.

To drive the aging simulation engine for "Beyond Time," I created a customized 3D facial data capture solution that is both fast and user-friendly. This solution allowed us to collect a comprehensive database of 3D facial scans from over 500 Japanese volunteers. Advanced pattern detection algorithms were then utilized to analyze this data, resulting in the identification of common aging patterns in Japanese faces. These efforts have enabled us to develop a simulation engine that accurately depicts aging in a Japanese population.
"Beyond Time" consists of two translucent booths located prominently in the lobby area, designed to draw the attention of all visitors.

Japan boasts the world's fastest aging population, and as a result, a significant portion of the population (9 out of 10) expresses fear of growing old. In Japanese culture, beauty is traditionally defined as a youthful appearance with flawless skin.

As a renowned and iconic beauty brand in Japan, Shiseido has taken on the challenge of expanding this narrow definition of beauty. To do so, we have created an interactive experience aimed at promoting a new understanding of beauty that includes the beauty of aging. The objective is to encourage the recognition of beauty at all stages of life.

Shiseido opened its Global Innovation Center, located in Yokohama, Japan, in April 2019. The center, which is the world's largest research and development hub and experiential space for cosmetics, was created to demonstrate Shiseido's commitment to innovation and scientific expertise. R/GA Tokyo was commissioned to design an experience for the center's launch that would highlight these qualities.

fields.title: Beyond Time
fields.subtitle: Shiseido
fields.description: "Beyond Time" is an interactive exhibit at Shiseido's Global Innovation Center that offers visitors a unique time travel experience. The installation allows pairs of individuals to view each other at different stages of their lives with the use of digital aging technology on their faces, encouraging them to explore the concept of beauty in aging, both physically and mentally.

content.value: My performance tells the story of my personal connection with my grandfather, who had a significant impact on my development, education, and personality. Sadly, he passed away a few years ago without me being present. Through this performance, I aim to honor his memory and the legacy he has left behind.
The Light Canvas material causes light drawings to fade after a few minutes, making it difficult to create a single, large drawing without missing parts.

To overcome this challenge, I was inspired by stop motion animation and designed my performance as a sequence of smaller drawings. Each individual drawing was designed to be quick to complete and have a clear connection to the preceding drawing. The narrative was advanced by overlaying new drawings on top of the previous ones.

The creators of Light Canvas invited me to perform at the festival as a demonstration of the installation's interactivity and potential for creativity. The goal of my performance was to generate a sense of awe and interest among the public.

The i Light Singapore Festival is a leading sustainable light festival in Asia, held in Marina Bay. The event features light art installations by both Singaporean and international artists, using energy-efficient lighting and/or environmentally-friendly materials. The purpose of these displays is to promote sustainability and encourage the adoption of sustainable habits among festival attendees and the general public.

fields.title: Public Performance at Light Canvas
fields.subtitle: i Light Singapore Festival
fields.description: The Light Canvas installation at the i Light Singapore Festival 2022 invited me to participate with a performance. The installation empowers the audience to turn their movements into illuminations, and I designed and executed a light painting performance to showcase its capabilities.

fields.title: 1000 Hours
fields.subtitle: A minimalist habit tracker
fields.description: 1000 Hours is a minimalist habit tracking application created through the combination of my personal skills and tools, including Figma and Flutter. The development process brought together expertise in UI/UX design, design language systems, and app development to create the final product, which was released on major platforms, including the Apple App Store, Android Play Store, and Huawei App Gallery.

content.value: Three months after the launch of the app, I've seen a successful uptake with over 3,000 downloads on the App Store. The feedback received from users across all platforms has been extremely valuable and has provided valuable insight into areas for improvement. Although the app is offered free of charge, I am pleasantly surprised to receive several donations from users, which has been a great source of encouragement.

As a result of user feedback, several new functions were added to the app. Previously, users could only manually input the hours they practiced. After receiving requests for an automatic timer, I decided to add this feature while ensuring its proper integration with the existing functions to maintain the app's stability and user experience.
To manage my limited time effectively, I adopted a priority matrix to evaluate feature requests and bug reports based on their impact on usability. This helped me to focus on the most crucial tasks.

However, initially, I received some negative feedback from users about the app's instability. In response, I dedicated numerous hours to improving the app's stability and enhancing the UI/UX design. Through several iterations and redesigns, I received more and more positive feedback from users via email and LinkedIn, who expressed their appreciation for the app.
The development and release of the app, powered by Flutter, was a great success as it was launched on three major app platforms, iOS App Store, Google Play Store, and Huawei App Gallery.

During the development process, I put significant effort into optimizing app performance and enhancing the code structure. To prioritize user data privacy, all user data is stored locally within the app. This eliminates the need for a login process and internet connection, simplifying the overall user experience. The app also features minimal opacity transitions and optimized widget functions, resulting in a smoother experience when using Flutter.

Additionally, I developed my own design system on Figma, which encompasses components, auto-layered page sections, edge cases, localization, and responsiveness to different screen sizes. The aim was to anticipate and address all technical considerations in the UI design phase.

I utilized various online tools to streamline the design process, including defining the design direction, selecting the color theme, creating animations for the splash screen and loading, and mapping out the user flow.

The development process of 1000 Hours was a journey filled with challenges and lessons learned. The idea for the rotatable wheel, which serves as the main interface for the app, was inspired by the iconic click wheel on the iPod. I believed that this intuitive design would allow users to input time accurately and effortlessly by simply spinning the dial. To bring this vision to life, I had to engage in extensive research and perform my own mathematical calculations, as there was no existing library available in the market that could meet my needs. Despite the difficulties, I was determined to create a user-friendly app that would help my wife track her dance practice time and make her journey easier.

The birth of 1000 Hours was inspired by my wife's quest to track her dance practice time. Despite searching, she couldn't find an app that met her needs. With my recent experience developing Zig, a comprehensive app with many advanced features, I confidently promised her that I could create an app tailored to her needs in just three days.
However,
I was surely overconfident at that moment.
It took me three months to finally complete the essential features of 1000 Hours.

Unlike other trackers that are filled with numerous reminders and complicated features, 1000 Hours is focused on helping users quickly and easily record every minute spent towards their goal. The key features of 1000 Hours include:
Goal Setting: Set habit goals, such as 1000 hours, and choose fun icons to represent them.
Tracking: Easily track the hours spent practicing each day by manually entering the time or using the built-in timer.
Memo: Keep a record of progress and daily experiences by leaving a diary with text and images.
History: View records in a calendar format to easily track progress over time.
1000 Hours is designed to address a simple need: tracking time spent practicing a habit.

content.value: The website is designed with Figma and implemented with Vue.js and Nuxt.js frameworks for better performance and stability. The home page is a web canvas showing Three.js animations and interactions. The other pages are composed of modular components customized based on Vuetify.js, where data from Contentful fully control all the content and page layout.

fields.title: Personal Portfolio
fields.description: Transform my knowledge of the latest web frameworks into a live website.

content.value: My current portfolio site is an evidence of me learning some latest frameworks and tools of web developments, such as Vue.js, Nuxt.js, and Contentful.

fields.title: Result
fields.description: 3000+ downloads within the first 3 months of the release.
